New Records: Jared McCain recorded a career-high 27 points against the Hornets.
Guerschon Yabusele scored a career-high 20 points against the Hornets.
Jeff Dowtin Jr. scored 11 points, one off his career high against the Hornets.
Kyle Lowry passed Tony Parker on the NBA’s all-time assists list with 7,038 assists.
Caleb Martin recorded the sixth four-steal game of his NBA career against Charlotte.
Pre-Game Insights: The Philadelphia 76ers (2-7) remain home to meet the New York Knicks (4-5) on Tuesday for their first 76ers Cup Night presented by Chick-fil-A.
The Sixers enter the matchup after a 107-105 overtime victory Sunday over Charlotte, while the Knicks fell to Indiana, 132-121, in Indianapolis.
It is the front end of a back-to-back for both clubs, with the Knicks hosting Chicago and the Sixers set to host the 12-0 Cleveland Cavaliers on Wednesday.
The 2024-25 Knicks boast the second-rated offense in the NBA (119.5 points per 100 possessions) through their first nine games.
Philadelphia leads the all-time regular season series 265-208 overall and 149-71 at home.
Post-Match Reflections: Jared McCain on guarding LaMelo Ball in overtime: 'For me, it’s kind of just being quiet. Everything is so loud around you, so just locking in on the ball and having a quiet mind. My psychologist calls it ‘feel the dance,’ and I just feel the flow and feel the dance and just wanted to get a stop, that’s all I wanted.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sixers are scheduled to wear their red Statement Edition uniforms for the first time this season, with the Knicks in their white Association Edition uniforms.
Tuesday also marks the first game on the Sixers’ new blue court for Philadelphia 76ers Cup Nights presented by Chick-fil-A.
Others: This was the first game on the Sixers’ new blue court for Philadelphia 76ers Cup Nights presented by Chick-fil-A.
